verbatim_example: One of the things we sacrifice as users is having that satisfying morning dump... Having been at *least* a week since last taking a problem free dump...
I feel like my blood pressure is through the roof, it messes with my vision and I sweat non-stop.

Everything bothers me, my place is trashed from not doing crap for months, I worry that I won't get better and need to get a new job. My motor skills aren't working because of all the anxiety I add to a rough situation and the lack of sleep I get.

I will say that I avoided many common opiate withdrawal symptoms this time around, no unbearable RLS, no violent sneezing or yawning at least not yet). It's mainly been extreme insomnia, anxiety, currently low grade depression that I know will increase in PAWs.
The withdrawal was really intense, I was stuck to my apartment for almost the entire 3 weeks.
I am in the thick of wd.
no shitting water, no puking, no seizures (from benzo wd), no sweats
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad.
I am happy to be here, sober .
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
But not like opiates high (except for the puking);
Forced down a small meal and vitamins this morning.
Few emotional spells, morning GI subsided
Still have the morning GI lingering around
I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day.
That's the worst the GI has been since day 6-7.
Weird - I don't want to use BAD here because things are improving from all angles, I also don't want to make it seem like a rose garden. So... I'm still having gnarly morning GI that tapers off.
GI is still a little weird but subsides after 2 morning trips.
Still some morning GI stuff. Clams come and go.
Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.
morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least)
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves.
still having some morning shit shows...
I've now gone five days without
Got lots of benzos just in case.
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way.

I was in absolutel agony, I literally layed in the shower crying for like 12 hours, every inch of my body hurt, migraines, sweating like a dog even though my condo was 62 degrees, throwing up, I was so tired but couldn't even lay on my bed because the RLS would start up instantly.

I bought some Kratom, and have some muscle relaxers for the withdrawl I may experience. But, truth be told - my withdrawl isn't anywhere near what I've seen in others. Bone pain and exhaustion is about it.
They gave me a cortisone shot and said it would take a few days to feel some relief and this morning I woke up feeling a lot better in that area, so I don't have a reason to take anymore.
I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting. When i try to eat or drink liquids all i do is puke them back up.
This wheel that I'm grateful for everyday that I don't have to be on.
Before my relapse 1 and 1/2 years ago, I had almost three years clean
I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.
I involuntary retched and threw up all over my room, also after both lines I sneezed at least 10 times in a row (no exaggeration) and an ungodly amount of snot began dripping from my nose.

I've been desperately trying anything and everything that I think might give me a rush. Masturbating. Weed. Listening to music. Popping insane amounts of gabapentin. They all just leave me wanting more.
I've been desperately trying anything and everything that I think might give me a rush. Masturbating. Weed. Listening to music. Popping insane amounts of gabapentin.
After a 3 month dry spell I got to pick up.
Currently working on an immodium taper, because I cannot deal with the vomiting, which I get REALLY bad during w/ds.
I didn't really want to take this dose but I was really afraid of getting serious gastro distress in the middle of work.
I had once mega dosed on Lope when I couldn't get seeds, and while it was miserable it did trade ~80% of W/D symptoms, for a aching upset stomach, but no vomiting, which was key for me.
Had real bad nausea last night, wasn't really anywhere near puking just, felt queasy.
Second issue is my guts. I have like 3 out of 10 nausea all day and haven't had a solid movement in 10 days(used Lope taper to quit.).
My guts also are, not great. I guess I forgot what getting sick is like? Also my chronic heartburn is back with a vengeance after stopping.
PS.  I have a gastroenterologist appt next week cause I haven't had a solid shit in 35 days, also troubling.

My last few posts have been about GI issues, I was being a baby and thought my body should be back to normal after just 2 mos. clean from 2 years using.  Idiot.  Colonoscopy clean, Endoscopy clean, I got these done for piece of mind, because I was going to the bathroom 6+ times a day every day, and wanted to make sure something wasn't seriously wrong.  It wasn't.  My body was abused.
My muscles twitch and roll, like someone has attached strings and pulls on them randomly for kicks. Cloudy head and jumpy jittery chicken sizzle muscles,
Bye-bye Egghead U, I'm going the hell home to a bath (my back!) and some sleep.
My body is like an old, tired sock... I keep wanting to stretch out, shake and use my muscles a bit. I'm so weak, it's been years.
I ate through half a box of crackers and two apples, some cheese, and I can't stop drinking water. It's like my body WANTS to get better now.
I still haven't seen the end of the bathroom craziness, my poor abused colon has no idea how to do its job any more.
Normal poo! Hallelujah, my colon has finally forgiven me!
Did you guys know if you eat six probio yogurts, you get to spend the next day running to the can at random moments? How can this stuff be good for you?
I've been in recovery for years and I still get heartburn and bloating all the time. It's like my stomach is always upset.
This shit takes the withdrawals away but it is almost not even worth it. Sometimes I can do half a bag or 2 bags before I go bat shit insane.
I find it gets me so nauseous that I don't even feel high.
kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago
My doc said I might have to use a bit while they adjust my dose.
when you feel you need to get out at moments of clarity and joy let it happen to let the Trick know what they have been missing. It doesn't have to be 24hr lockdown after the initial withdrawls.
I can tell the difference. Gotta keep my mind focused.
I knew just how screwed I truley was. This behavior went on for a while until I reached out and went to a Suboxone doctor.
This withdrawal was maybe 2/10th the strength of just going cold turkey.
I was in brutal pain and going through withdrawals such as the tingling sensations.
Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals
Well unbeknownst to me I got stuck consciously in this pattern and did not recognize my body and could not feel my extremities.

I remember endless aching
Timeless nights spent sleepless, taking
anything to stop the shaking,
Anything i'd found
Thinking nothing, feeling hollow
planning all the highs to follow
all the pain and pills to swallow
my eyes are watering like I'm almost crying for no reason so thats fun. Can't wait to hit the bathroom for the first time in weeks.
I feel like a zombie that needs to run to the toilet every five.

I went to buy a bag, but my dude know we trying to stop putting money in his pocket so the mf gives me four bags for free, cool dude, right? No, cuz now I’m going back to buy 10 more because those four bags put us back a hell of a lot and we are not ready to start all over.
They make the W 80% better, I am at day 3 of W but it feels like day 1.
I still have running lava from my ass and only sleep five hours a night
The problem tho is that I have had mild withdrawals after that. How is that even possible?

I had to start the wd all over but it is like 1/3 painfull so I am actually enjoying myself. I mean it is still shitty but not to the point where I can’t function, and that makes me able to do some normal erryday stuff.
Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won’t have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself.
The only WD symtoms I am still having is the sleep, only got 3 hours of sleep last night.
Bowl movements are still screwed up.
Sleep is good, got over 6 hours the past two nights and my appetite is more than good now lol.
I am not going to go back and accept I made a mistake but did I just put myself back at day one again of withdraws?

My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol. Something I could never do even in my other quit attempts so I guess I’m all in this time.
today I woke up around the same time and woke up sweaty with chills and hot flashes
We lost everything due to missing work due to withdrawals and kept coming back to it,
Until one day I just had to leave because I was dope sick
Whenever I used H I can count on 1 foot how many times I've thrown up, but now that I snort PK I always seem to throw up even off of 20 mg!!!

Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough. I have to say I don't feel as bad, physically, as I did when coming off oxy. But my state of mind is in the trash.
I haven't been sick in years, at least I haven't felt sick, other than withdrawals, in years.
While I am currently keeping withdrawals at bay with 10 - 20mg a day of OC (I was pretty steady at 50 - 100mg a day, every day),
I have clonazepam + my nightly 20mg extendedbullshitoxy to come down, but I have enough speed to stay up for a while ;)
I had my last oxy yesterday morning -- then I had about 1mg of sub last night, and I'm 100% dry
Even on a sunny day, I'm shivering, and my nose is draining. I love all of you and will still come here, and I'll chip monthly -- after a month clean.
Recently I drove a 2014 Honda accord. All I thought was "damn, I'd love to have that car." I estimate I've spent no less than $25,000 USD (but likely far more), and that car was only 21,000.
I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.
Lot harder to shake today than yesterday.
I felt immense relief from the nasty cravings I was/am getting for my DOC.
Unable to keep any food or even water down.

Even now, on day 6 and just barely through the worst of the physical symptoms, my desire to use is still there. My desire to stay clean is also still there and this is why I'm posting about it and why I've been on the phone all morning.
I'm tripping balls. I've been thankful to have some extra time before the event to continue to work on my shit but I'm also terrified that the life upheaval will be more than I WANT to handle.
I have been homeless have boosted and done various other things for a daily fix.
I had no idea what it was and one night complained to my boyfriend about it. We started using together and he was shocked when he had the same shit happening to him.
I swear the withdrawals are just as bad if not worse than last time I detoxed even though I was doing significantly less, diff ROA and shorter time period. I'm almost 24 hours in and miserable.
I'm at the breaking point. I'm just trying to not let myself leave the house right now.
this morning was the worst so far. Haven't slept still at all, just absolutely miserable and losing my mind.
This combined with the physical symptoms were too much to bear.
When we don't eat healthily our entire bodies pretty much shut down and we both become very tired, irritable, and lack motivation.
coming off a 3 week heroin binge that started because of my dopesick coming off of oxycodone.
mild cramping in my ribs, havent puked once yet
It was a really good idea. Thinking of coppin again on the weekend for Saturday night because I play a show... may hold off a bit longer so my W/D experience isnt as bad.
because for some reason I don't feel a craving for Oxy like I do with Heroin and as long as I do a tiny bit of opiate I can usually endure any remaining w/d symptoms.
Whenever one of us needs to get sober, despite the pain, the other is always right there. It's really nice.
the withdrawal symptoms i get when i wake up in the morning are a bit worse than i'd have from the suboxone, but still not really anything that bad.
Update to the best opiates in the worst form post... (Cross-section of the Exalgo and the powder for the dremeled Opana)

About 5 years ago, was having serious stomach pain, after seeing dr's, getting colonoscopy resulted in polyps which will turn cancerous some day, having to be checked every 5 years til i'm dead. Dr said I needed to stop whatever it was that was causing the problem, stress was the cause.
I was in hardcore, white knuckle, cold turkey withdrawal(puking, shitting, cold sweats, can't get comfortable, etc).
The withdrawals are getting pretty bad. I puked alot this morning.
The discomfort and anxiety is causing me so much depression. Just having to make dinner for my girl tonight was a monumental task.
stomach cramping, aches, slight runny nose...
The last few nights I've woken up gasping for air in a total panic for no reason at all.
I was flopping and moaning in pain like a fish.
I wake up throwing up because of the short half life
I'm eating 20 mix of pills (clonodine, diazepam, visteril, tylonal and whatever helps until my dealer wakes up) and that barely keeps the WD at bay.
I wake up in severe pain if I haven't used within 12 hours. It feels like RLS but more like restless body syndrome with unrelentless pain, like 100 people are hitting my whole body with a hammer.
I'm talking puking and everything so I just went back to what I knew fixed it.
I still feel very short-tempered & irritable. Those things don't go well in my line of work.
I haven't been tempted even once... shaking and puking through the lonely nights
I can't imagine being out in the rain or snow and experiencing withdrawal, praying that someone will come through or that you can scrounge up enough money to pick up and not be sick.
This is the last time I will go through this. chills, and I'm sweating anyway
My eyes are watering and I'm sneezing... Got the crippling sadness today. I am super overwhelmed with not using.
five and a half months ain't goin' out like that.
The obsession left and has never returned, at least not anything close to what I used to feel: the clammy hands, writhing stomach, and murderous determination to get a fix.

verbatim_example: And inside is some of the best dope I've ever snorted!
Days one and two were god awful; my whole body hurt

This week my mom found a bunch of rigs (thankfully she didn't find my stash) and we decided I should go to inpatient again. This week I've shot somewhere around ~100 bags and a little bit of coke since last Friday.
